meanings.definition: A proposition supporting or helping to support a conclusion.
meanings.sent1: The premise of the argument was that all students should have equal access to education.
meanings.sent2: The detective based his theory on the premise that the suspect had a motive.
meanings.sent3: The premise of the joke was that cats are afraid of cucumbers.
meanings.sent4: Her success was built on the premise that hard work pays off.
meanings.sent5: The premise of the story was that love conquers all obstacles.

meanings.definition: A piece of land or building used for a particular purpose.
meanings.sent1: The new restaurant was built on the premise of an old bakery.
meanings.sent2: The office building was constructed on the premise of an old factory.
meanings.sent3: The premise of the park was to provide a peaceful retreat for the community.
meanings.sent4: The premise of the farm was to grow organic vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The premise of the school was to foster creativity and innovation.

meanings.definition: A statement that is assumed to be true and from which a conclusion can be drawn.
meanings.sent1: The scientific study was based on the premise that water boils at 100 degrees Celsius.
meanings.sent2: The legal argument relied on the premise that the defendant was innocent until proven guilty.
meanings.sent3: The premise of the math problem was that all angles in a triangle add up to 180 degrees.
meanings.sent4: The premise of the theory was that all living organisms require water to survive.
meanings.sent5: The premise of the experiment was that plants grow towards sunlight for photosynthesis.
